original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields end higher, rupee at 321/321.30 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond and t-bill yields were up at close on Wednesday, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 27.90/28.20 percent up from 27.60/28.00 percent from a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 27.00/27.15 percent, up from 26.75/27.00 percent at last close.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 25.90/97 percent, steady from 25.85/26.00 percent.
The one year bill closed at 22.70/23.00 percent, up from 22.00/30 percent from the last close.
The rupee closed at 321/30 to the US dollar in the spot market slightly depreciated from Tuesday’s close at 320.30/321.30 rupees. (Colombo/April19/2023)
